metadata.name: Pragmatics & Context
metadata.description: Contextual meaning, inference, and language use.

entries.definition: The study of how context, intention, and situation affect meaning.
Situational, social, and linguistic factors surrounding an utterance.
How language is actually used by speakers in real contexts.
Variation in language style depending on context or audience.
An utterance that performs an action rather than merely describing.
Meaning inferred from context rather than explicitly stated.
Context-dependent expressions such as person, place, or time references.
